boat.full_description:
Built by her first owner, Peter Martinez, in his Hampshire garden, and named 'Lucinda' after his wife, the first home built Cornish Crabber Pilot Cutter was launched at Deacons Boatyard, Bursledon in 1986. She was then taken to the Mayflower Marina, Plymouth. Designer, Roger Dongrey came to visit and inspect the work during the build.

Cornish Pilot Cutter P5 (Cornish Crabbers Ltd.) 30' LOA 

Main areas of upgrade 2014-18 by current owner have been as follows

Interior Refurbishment - Complete replacement of interior cabin to represent the modern style of the Crabber..

New Beta 30- installed 2014 with Darglow Feather-stream three-blade prop, then annual service by the same engineers within the yard.

Electrics upgraded - Maxpower bow-thruster, new switch panels, wiring and fusing arrangements, Adverc Management system, recent Batteries.

Electronics upgraded - complete range of mainly B&G Zeus for Nav Electronics, also B&G Halo 20 Radar, AIS with Transponder and V50 VHF - all installed by the same professional Electronics Engineer.

Life Raft - Seago in deck canister, purchased new 2021 and in-date, four-man capacity, fitted on custom-built coachroof S.S. cradle.

Deck gear - includes Lofrans Cobra windlass, with remote control, also custom-made stem fittings to house the plough anchor and integral with S.S bowsprit housing, plus S.S. pin-rails for halyards and running rig.

Interior ballast - installed and sealed within the encapsulated keel structure,; within the keel moulding is ‘housing' for the galvanised steel centre-plate, controlled in cockpit with drum-winch.

Sprayhood/cockpit enclosure - all custom-made to provide protection for equipment and systems
boat.name: Lucinda

ownerships.note: P Martinez was the first owner. At some stage William Jewel became owner and he sold her to Paul Raine.
